##"everything stopped" why is the smog so heavy? I see

Weixin caijingEleven

The function introduction by "CAIJING" Magazine Company Industry Report team to create, discuss the success or failure of the enterprise, explore the rise and fall of the industry, promote sunshine business

The pollutants from heating and industry, which account for more than two-thirds of the emissions in autumn and winter, have not decreased, adding to the extremely adverse weather conditions, resulting in heavy smog

Han Shulin, Xu Peiyu | Wen

Mark | editor

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Spring Festival holiday superimposed on the impact of the epidemic, Beijing has few enterprises to resume work, the flow of people is sparse, traffic is smooth, but the smog is still serious.

The air quality in Beijing has been above moderate pollution for four consecutive days since February 9, and the last two days have been heavily polluted. real-time statistics from the Ministry of Ecological Environment show that as of 6:00 p.m. on February 12, beijing's Air Quality Index remains as high as 255.

Factories have stopped, traffic has dropped off, construction has stopped, but the smog is still happening. In addition to the poor air quality in recent days, data showed that the city had experienced four consecutive days of moderate and severe pollution between January 25 and 28 during the previous holiday.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Change trend of air quality index in Beijing in the last 30 Days Source: Data Center of Ministry of Ecological Environment

This is true not only in Beijing, but also in the entire beijing-tianjin-hebei region and its surrounding areas. Where does the smog come from?

On February 11, the Ministry of Ecology and environment published an article on the recent heavy air pollution in Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei and surrounding areas. Generally speaking, the cause of haze is related to the emission on the one hand and the atmospheric environmental capacity on the other hand. When the emission exceeds the atmospheric environmental capacity, air pollution will occur. Although the emissions did decrease under the influence of the holiday and epidemic situation, the main sources of the emissions in autumn and winter were from the industries of Florida and the heating of Florida, it is difficult for pollutants to spread, and the combination of the two factors leads to the re-emergence of smog.

For the future air quality in Beijing, the Ministry of Environmental Protection issued a forecast that said the air quality gradually improved during the night due to high cold pressure on the 13th, and remained at level 5 heavy pollution throughout the day. 14-18 days of good diffusion conditions, good air quality. The 19-20 day dispersion situation deteriorated, the air quality is expected in light pollution levels. On the 21st, the air quality gradually improved under the influence of the mid-upper air cold trough.

Limited emission reduction

Although the reduction of social activities led to a reduction in emissions, but in fact, the main force of pollution did not retreat.

He Kebin, a member of the Chinese Academy of Engineering and Dean of the School of Environment at Tsinghua University, said that most of the construction sites, traffic flow, catering and labor-intensive light industries were indeed shut down, from New Year's Eve to the 15th day of the first lunar month in 2020, the regional average concentration of PM10 dropped by 13.3% and NO2 by 22.6% compared with the same period of the 2019 Spring Festival.

However, the emissions from heating and resource-based industries did not change significantly. On heating, he Kebin said that a large number of migrant workers have returned to their hometown. Although some rural areas have changed from coal to gas, more than 10 million households still use coal for heating. This year's Spring Festival is compared with the same period last year, in rural areas, Co concentrations measured by the amount of coal burned increased by more than 10 per cent.

On the Industrial Front, Hecobin said that the current stoppages are mainly concentrated in the processing industry, light and heavy industries. The major sources of industrial air pollutant emissions are mainly resource-based industries with high pollution and high energy consumption, such as thermal power, steel, coking, glass, Refractory, petrochemical, alumina, electrolytic aluminum and so on, these industries often have production processes that can not be interrupted, need to run all year round.

Heavy industry data on related emissions also showed that they were not affected by the holiday. According to online pollution monitoring data, emissions from the fire and steel industries dropped by about 10 percent from the first to the 15th day of the Lunar New Year, he said, coking, petrochemical, glass, nonferrous metals and other industries have no obvious trend of change.

Based on this, he said that in the beijing-tianjin-hebei region and its surrounding areas, as many as two-thirds of industrial and heating emissions in autumn and winter have not substantially decreased, and these sources are also the base emissions for the region, when the environment capacity is reduced due to the adverse weather conditions, the base discharge will exceed the environment capacity and heavy pollution will occur.

Another major cause of urban smog is motor vehicle exhaust emissions. The traffic flow remains low under the influence of holidays and epidemics. However, with the gradual resumption of work, the impact on the climate can not be ignored.

Xu Honglei, director of the Environment Institute at the Ministry of Transport of the People's Republic of China, said that during the Spring Festival, the traffic of trucks and buses on roads in Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei and the surrounding areas dropped by 77 percent and 39 percent, respectively. And affected by the epidemic, after the Spring Festival holiday, regional traffic flow remains relatively low level, rough estimates, regional traffic pollution emissions from at least 40% . According to the data from the monitoring stations of the Ministry of Ecology and environment, the concentration of NO2 in Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei and the surrounding "2 + 26" cities dropped about 30% from the spring festival to the 15th of the first lunar month.

After the resumption of work, although the city traffic is not congested, but the traffic impact can not be ignored. Xu Honglei said that on February 10 and 11, with the resumption of work and production, the traffic flow within and between cities began to increase significantly again, and the concentration of NO2 increased significantly compared with the previous period, the monitoring of PM2.5 in Beijing showed that the proportion of nitrate increased greatly, and became the main factor for raising PM2.5 concentration. This suggests that NOx (nitrogen oxide) emissions from motor vehicles are still a major cause of regional air pollution.

Adverse weather conditions

While the emission reduction is limited, the adverse climate conditions have also aggravated the smog production.

According to Wang Zifa, a researcher at the Institute of Atmospheric Physics under the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the emissions of PM2.5, SO2, NOx and VOCs in "2 + 26" cities have dropped by about 20-30 percent since the Spring Festival compared with the autumn and winter average levels, due to the holiday and epidemic situation.

But at the same time, there are frequent adverse weather conditions in the region, such as long time static stability, strong temperature inversion and high humidity. The average wind speed on the whole is less than 2 m / s, the relative humidity is higher than 60% , and the temperature inversion is as high as 10 °C, the height of the boundary layer is reduced to 300-500 meters (1 / 2 to 1 / 3 of that under normal circumstances) , and heavy fog occurs in central Beijing-tianjin-hebei region, central Henan Province and western Shandong Province.

Temperature inversion is one of the key factors affecting the diffusion of pollutants. Under normal circumstances, the higher the altitude, the lower the temperature, the air from warm to cold flow, which is conducive to vertical diffusion of pollutants. In the event of a temperature inversion, however, the situation is just the opposite. The upper air temperature is higher than the ground, and the vertical rise of the air is blocked. The air is covered over the area like a LID, and the pollutants are difficult to spread. 10-degree inversion is a strong inversion.

Wang Zifa explained that pollution emissions had dropped, but by a much smaller amount than the environmental capacity, and that while social activities were at a lower level, pollutant emissions were still more than twice the environmental capacity.

In addition, Beijing this time the smog also has the obvious input characteristic. Wang spontaneously said that "2 + 26" cities in Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei and their surrounding areas are in the same atmospheric flow field. Sometimes these cities are under adverse meteorological conditions simultaneously, and sometimes they occur locally, which is called "meteorological convergence" , pollutants can build up in the convergence center. Since the Spring Festival this year, Beijing and Tianjin and other surrounding cities have experienced meteorological convergence and heavy pollution, while cities in Henan, Shandong and other provinces continue to have excellent air quality.

He Kebin said that under the current "2 + 26" urban emission intensity, although the total emissions have been reduced, most of the pollutants emitted by the cities are concentrated in a few cities, make the air pollutant carrying capacity of these cities far exceed the environmental capacity, heavy pollution will occur, Beijing, Tianjin and other cities are such a situation. According to the monitoring data, the concentration of sulfur dioxide in Beijing is more than three times that of the previous few days. Sulfate and nitrate are the main factors that pull up the concentration of PM2.5, which shows that the influence of external transmission is still very big.

Liu Qian, Greenpeace's senior program director for climate and energy, also told Caijing that air pollution is caused when pollution from industrial and Human Activities Causes Air Pollutants to carry far more than the environmental capacity. Under the steady weather condition of high humidity, low pressure and strong inversion, the air pollution will increase the pollution intensity and prolong the pollution time because it is difficult to dissipate.

As for the contrast between the social perception and the actual pollution phenomenon, Yue Xin, a researcher at the Chinese Academy of Environmental Sciences, told Caijing that in terms of popular science propaganda, people are not fully aware of the extent to which meteorological conditions affect the process of atmospheric pollution, which is in fact far more than is directly felt by the average person, such as the appearance of an inversion layer, it is possible to increase the concentration of pollutants under normal circumstances by several times, resulting in heavy pollution; the amount of pollutants emitted is very huge and far beyond people's imagination, simply feeling that the traffic volume is small, and some industries and enterprises are on vacation, cutting production, and shutting down production, but there are still a lot of industries that we don't have direct contact with, that we don't know much about, that are emitting a lot of pollutants. Adverse weather conditions and pollutant emissions are still very large, and it is not surprising that heavy pollution processes occur.

Liu Qian told Caijing that to completely improve air quality, further reduce the frequency of air pollution and reduce the degree of air pollution, it is necessary to further accelerate industrial restructuring and energy restructuring. The use of more clean electricity, as well as the continuous improvement of emission standards and monitoring of high-polluting industries, will play a crucial role in improving air quality in the Beijing-tianjin-hebei region and even the whole country.

For this pollution, he kebin summed up its characteristics as: The impact of a smaller area, longer accumulation time, shorter duration, lower peak concentration, less pollution. In his view, the pollution process is similar to that of November 23-27,2016, when the level of emissions may exceed the number of cities. In view of this, he also suggested that cities in the beijing-tianjin-hebei region and surrounding areas should have a chess idea. In the future, they must adhere to the principle of joint prevention, joint control and joint control, and persistently carry out the adjustment of energy structure, industrial structure, traffic structure and land use structure, we will strengthen pollution emission control, substantially reduce the intensity of air pollution emissions and constantly improve environmental air quality.

The writer is a reporter for CAIJING
